symbolic.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a symbolic action is important because of what it represents but may not have any real effect
symbolic.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The protest was a symbolic gesture of anger at official policy.
It was a largely symbolic gesture from a government trying to win support.
symbolic.translation[0].definitions[1].d: representing a particular idea or quality
symbolic.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Each element of the ceremony has a symbolic meaning.
Todayâ€™s fighting is symbolic of the chaos which the country is facing.
symbolic.translation[0].definitions[2].e: A map is a form of symbolic representation.
symbolic.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: They fired arrows out to sea in a symbolic gesture of defiance.
Lighting the Olympic flame is a symbolic act.
The capture of the city was of great symbolic importance.
Our protest was meant to be purely symbolic.
